definition: to set out/to leave

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
rule/order/regulations/formula/journey/procedure/sequence
surname Cheng

sentences.english: Thee second day early in the morning, we are ready to depart, they buy a bicycle.
sentences.chinese: 第二天一早，我們準備起程，上香蘭買自行車。

sentences.english: The steamer set out on a sunny morning.
sentences.chinese: 輪船在一個陽光明媚的早晨起程了。

sentences.english: They left Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
sentences.chinese: 由匝耳摩納起程，在普農紮營。

sentences.english: So saying, he departed for Benares.
sentences.chinese: 說完，他起程回了貝拿勒斯。

sentences.english: Then, all too early, it was time for Lian Yucheng to end his visit and go home.
sentences.chinese: 招待結束後，連玉成也該起程回家了。

sentences.english: And departing from Cades, they camped in mount Her, in the uttermost borders of the land of Edom.
sentences.chinese: 由卡德士起程，在位於厄東地邊界上的曷爾山下紮營。

sentences.english: First, as was said, he must have some entrance into the language before he goeth.
When it is time to leave, you will go reluctantly.
sentences.chinese: 當你該起程回家時，你會依依不捨。

sentences.english: The next day, Fan Chin escorted Chou Chin for 15 kilometers on his way back to the capital.
sentences.chinese: 次日，周進起程回京，范進獨自送到三十里以外。

sentences.english: Enhance the newly-weds taste of jewelry and watches by serving as reference for both appreciation and guidance.
sentences.chinese: 從欣賞性和指導性起程擢升新人認識珠寶腕錶的價值。

sentences.english: So Sennacherib, king of Assyria, departed, returned home and lived in Nineveh.
sentences.chinese: 亞述王散乃黑黎佈於是拔營，起程回國，住在尼尼微。

sentences.english: Marius might have set out that very evening and have been with his father on the following morning.
sentences.chinese: 馬呂斯本可當晚起程，第二天一早到他父親身旁的。

definition: to go on a journey/to leave
to set out (of troops)/departure/start date (of military expedition)
to set out on a journey
to return/to go back/to come back
to strike camp
to say goodbye/leave-taking/farewells
to travel day and night
to travel at double speed/to make all haste
to take leave
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
to return to the capital
to meet/to rendezvous/to merge/to link up/meeting/confluence
clothes and other items packed for traveling/baggage/luggage
to take leave
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
via/by way of/en route to
